show.title: VHYes
show.headline: Press play on this offbeat coming-of-age comedy

event.title: <show-title>VHYes</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: A found footage kaleidoscope, with cast & filmmakers in-person!
event.description:
A bizarre retro comedy shot entirely on VHS, VHYES takes us back to a simpler time, when 12-year-old Ralph mistakenly records home videos and his favorite late-night shows over his parents’ wedding tape. The result is a nostalgic wave of home shopping clips, censored pornography, and nefarious true-crime tales that threaten to unkindly rewind Ralph’s reality.

The crew of VHYES will join us for an in-person Q&A. Producer Delaney Schenker will attend the Q&As in Austin, and will be joined by filmmaker Jack Henry Robbins in NYC, DC, San Francisco, and L.A. Creator and director of photography Nate Gold will join the Q&As in San Francisco and L.A. Thomas Lennon will also join the Q&A in L.A.

Screening courtesy of Oscilloscope Laboratories & Hot Winter Films

show.title: Night Call

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine’s hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin’ tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That’s why we’re inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Sing-Along Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We’ll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, “gold” necklaces to show you’re a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Sing-Along Movie Party. You’ll be belting out all of Conner4Real’s greatest hits so loudly, it’ll be like you just opened your Aquaspin refrigerator. DOINK DE DOINK!

show.title: The Substance
show.headline: A gorgeously gross beauty regimen that will change your life

show.title: Death Becomes Her
show.headline: Keep young and beautiful – or die trying!

event.title: <show-title>Death Becomes Her</show-title>
event.headline: Goldie Hawn & Meryl Streep slay the screen in this 1992 fatal femme cult classic
event.description:
“Now, a warning…”

What would you do to stay young forever? This is an evergreen question in many cinematic and literary explorations, from Oscar Wilde to the copious vampire narratives we consume, from THE SUBSTANCE to Korean skincare TikToks hocking the perfect recipe for “glass skin,” we are a species obsessed with delaying time's inevitable progression. Robert Zemeckis’ 1992 black comedy (co-written by Journeymen screenwriter David Koepp and Martin Donovan) DEATH BECOMES HER is a classic example of this trope played out in gloriously campy fashion. Goldie Hawn and Meryl Streep are Helen Sharp and Madeline Ashton, two frenemies who compete in all things, especially for the attention and affection of dopey plastic surgeon Ernest Menville (played against type by a delightful Bruce Willis). When presented with a method of reversing and halting their aging by the gorgeous and mysterious vamp Lisle Von Rhuman (THE ICON Isabella Rosellini) both women seize the clandestine opportunity, and from there, things get grim and zany. Overflowing with subtextual sapphic angst and seething with a deep investment in the emasculation of cis straight men, this movie is a freaking blast! Groundbreaking Acadamy Award-winning special effects and hilarious performances from its entire cast helped launch DEATH BECOMES HER to cult classic status (especially amongst queer audiences) despite mixed reviews from critics. As Madeline would say, “Screw the critics” – this movie is a STAR! Help us kick off the 2025 season of Queer Film Theory 101 with a dose of the potion with the motion. Stay beautiful, queerdos (but then again, you always are.)

show.title: Hippo
show.headline: A David Gordon Green/Danny McBride/Jody Hill-approved blast of cine-weirdness

event.title: <show-title>Hippo</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Live Q&A with the cast and crew
event.description:
Director/co-writer Mark H. Rappaport will attend the live Q&As in Austin and New York City. Joining Rappaport in NYC are actor/co-writer Kimball Farley and cinematographer William Babcock, moderated by executive producer David Gordon Green. Actor Eliza Roberts will attend the live Q&A in Los Angeles.

HIPPO examines the coming-of-age of two step-siblings: Hippo, a video-game-addicted teenager, and Buttercup, a Hungarian-Catholic immigrant with a love of classical music and Jesus. Like the Ancient Greek Aphrodite, Buttercup’s love is unrequited by a brother who prefers to indulge in the art of war and chaos.

show.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
show.headline: Edgar Wright's hyper-kinetic adaptation of the cult comic

event.title: <show-title>Scott Pilgrim vs. the World</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Fourth wall-crushing epicness
event.description:
WE ARE ALAMO DRAFTHOUSE AND WE ARE HERE TO SHOW YOU AWESOME MOVIES AND HAVE FUN AND STUFF!

That’s where our SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party comes in. It’s a film of pure joy. An epic love letter to geek culture straight from the hearts of Edgar Wright and Bryan Lee O'Malley.

We love SCOTT PILGRIM. We love you. So in this spirit of love, we’ve brought back this epic of epicness in an epic way: with fourth wall-crushing props like a Scott Pilgrim inflatable bass guitar to channel your inner Scott (or Young Neil) as you jam along to the electrifying soundtrack, a 1-Up acrylic keychain, and a custom double-sided "pixelated" pressed zinc coin that you don’t even need to smash any evil exes to get – all included in your ticket.

It's the SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party and it will punch the highlights right out of your hair. Just remember, the password is “whatever”.

show.title: Shrek
show.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told

event.title: <show-title>Shrek</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told
event.description:
When a green ogre called Shrek discovers his swamp has been "swamped" with all sorts of fairytale creatures by the scheming Lord Farquaad, Shrek sets out, with a very loud donkey by his side, to persuade Farquaad to give his swamp back. Instead, a deal is made. Farquaad, who wants to become the king, sends Shrek to rescue Princess Fiona, who is waiting for her one true love. But once they head back with Fiona, it starts to become apparent that not only does Shrek like Fiona, but Fiona is keeping something secret.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Ogre ears
  • Onion keychain
  • Eye-pop bird
  • Smell-along card

show.title: The Wedding Singer
show.headline: Party with Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore like it's 1985

event.title: <show-title>The Wedding Singer</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party with Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore like it's 1985
event.description:
Among several rom-coms from 1998 that grew up to become classics (YOU'VE GOT MAIL! THERE'S SOMETHING ABOUT MARY!), THE WEDDING SINGER stands out as the first (and arguably best) romantic pairing of Adam Sandler + Drew Barrymore.

Sandler plays Robbie, a burnt-out singer at weddings and bar mitzvahs who aspires to become a real musician. While working a wedding, he meets the new waitress Julia (Barrymore), who is kind, effervescent, and impossible not to love. The catch? Both Robbie and Julia are engaged to human pieces of garbage. Robbie is quickly saved from a lifetime of misery when he's left at the altar, but Julia is still head-over-heels in love with total douchebag Glenn and set on becoming Mrs. Julia Guglia. While mending a broken heart (and when he's not writing the best breakup song of all time), Robbie puts his wedding industry knowledge to good use by helping Julia plan her wedding. All their friends notice the sparks flying, but both brush it off and claim they're totally just friends. Suuuuure....

THE WEDDING SINGER features a fantastic supporting cast: Sandler's frequent collaborator Allen Covert, Christine Taylor, Ellen Albertini Dow, even Billy Idol! The soundtrack is even better: David Bowie, The Smiths, more Billy Idol, and two originals by Sandler that are quite possibly the best breakup and love songs ever made.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Music sheets
  • Squishy meatball
  • Cassette keychain

event.title: <show-title>Presence</show-title> <event-type-title>DEAD Talk Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Is Alamo Drafthouse haunted? Find out with a real paranormal investigator.
event.description: Are ghosts really walking among us? Make your moviegoing experience even spookier at our exclusive DEAD Talk screening (Discussing Existence After Death), where a paranormal investigator will conduct a live ghost-hunting showcase after the movie. They’ll explain how modern ghost hunting works, demonstrate some of their tech, and maybe even commune with a specter or two. Your ticket gets you a wristband for the demonstration and a drink at the bar. So leave your disbelief at the door, open yourself to the other side, and join us for an evening of ghostly chills, both on and off the screen.

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in Cats scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you’ve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that’ll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We’ll have candles to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, bracelets from the Opera Ghost (or the Angel of Music, not sure which), and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

show.title: Hippo
show.headline: A David Gordon Green/Danny McBride/Jody Hill-approved blast of cine-weirdness

show.title: Ghost (1990)
show.headline: A love that will last forever

event.title: <show-title>Ghost (1990)</show-title>
event.headline: A classic supernatural romance film that made the world horny for pottery wheels
event.description:
“Molly, you in danger, girl.”

But then again, aren’t we all in danger at the end of the day? Despite many more pressing matters, it seems that the “danger” we often fear the most is that of loss or abandonment. How do we rebuild our lives when we’ve lost someone who shaped our existence? And how do those we’ve lost move on when they feel like they have unfinished business in this world? In Jerry Zucker’s 1990 supernatural romance film GHOST, some of these questions are asked and…kinda answered. Listen, don’t expect any huge revelations about mortality and the afterlife. This isn’t Bergman – think TWILIGHT, not THE SEVENTH SEAL. And it’s pretty damn queer!

Pretty boy Sam Wheat (Patrick Swayze) leads a charmed life with androgynous artist girlfriend Molly Jensen (Demi Moore) until a violent mugging leaves Sam dead and Molly in shambles. But there’s more – Sam is a ghost now (hence the title) and he’s determined to protect Molly from impending danger with the help of dubious medium Ode May Brown (Whoopi Goldberg). Yes, there is cross-gender body-hopping, don’t worry. Erotic pottery, a boyish hairstyle that made headlines, and an Oscar-winning performance from Goldberg turned this spectral romp into the top-grossing film of 1990. Written by queer screenwriter Bruce Joel Rubin (he also wrote JACOB'S LADDER – this dude loves metaphysics), GHOST is filled with subtextual interrogations of liminality, gender, and identity. Plus Swayze is in it, and as we’ve said before, Patrick Swayze has never made a “straight” film. Happy Valentine’s season queers. We love you! (Now you say “ditto.”)

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
